abstract.text: Presents frames to the compression session and invokes the output callback when compression is complete.

inlineContent.text: The compression session.
A Core Video image buffer (
) containing a video frame to be compressed. The buffer must have a nonzero reference count.
The presentation timestamp for this frame, to be attached to the sample buffer. Each presentation timestamp passed to a session must be greater than the previous one.
The presentation duration for this frame, to be attached to the sample buffer. If you do not have duration information, pass
Key/value pairs specifying additional properties for encoding this frame. Note that some session properties may also be changed between frames. Such changes affect subsequently encoded frames.
A pointer to a
to receive information about the encode operation.
The
bit may be set if the encode is (or was) running asynchronously.
The
bit may be set if the frame was dropped (synchronously).
Pass
if you do not want to receive this information.
The block to be called when encoding the frame is completed. This block may be called asynchronously, on a different thread from the one that calls

Encoded frames may or may not be output before the function returns. The client should not modify the pixel data after making this call. The session and/or encoder retains the image buffer as long as necessary.
This function cannot be called with a session created with a

abstract.text: A value that represents an invalid time.
A reference to a Core Video image buffer.
Work directly with hardware-accelerated video encoding and decoding capabilities.
A callback for the system to invoke when it’s finished compressing a frame.
A callback for the system to invoke when it’s finished compressing a frame.
A reference to a VideoToolbox compression session.
Forces the compression session to complete the encoding of frames.
Presents frames to the compression session and invokes the output callback when compression is complete.
Presents frames to the compression session.
Returns a pool that provides ideal source pixel buffers for a compression session.
Enables the encoder to perform any necessary resource allocation before the encoder begins encoding frames (optional).
A flag that indicates that an encode operation ran asynchronously.
A flag that indicates that a frame dropped during encoding.
A reference to an immutable dictionary object.
A reference to a Core Video image buffer.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
